Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie. I’ve been doing okay. I managed to stick to the walks and tried a new recipe!
That’s fantastic! How did the recipe turn out?
It was a little rough around the edges, but it was edible! I made a stir-fry with lots of veggies.
That’s a great choice! Cooking can be a fun way to explore healthy eating. How did you feel after making it?
I felt accomplished, like I was taking charge of my health a bit.
That’s an empowering feeling! Have you noticed any changes in your motivation or mood since we last spoke?
I think I’ve been feeling a little more motivated, but I still have my days where I just don’t want to do anything.
That’s completely normal, especially when coping with grief. It’s important to honor those feelings too. Have you found any strategies that help when you’re feeling low?
The grounding exercise has been helpful. I’ve used it a couple of times when I start to spiral.
That’s great to hear! It’s all about finding what works for you. Have you had any moments that felt particularly challenging recently?
Yeah, I had a day where I just felt really sad and overwhelmed. I missed my uncle a lot.
It’s understandable to have those moments, especially around anniversaries or significant dates. How did you cope with that sadness?
I ended up watching some old movies we used to enjoy together. It felt comforting.
That’s a lovely way to connect with his memory. It’s important to honor those feelings and find ways to remember him.
Yeah, it helped a lot.
As we continue, would you like to explore any new coping strategies or goals for this week?
I’d like to try to incorporate some mindfulness practices into my routine.
That sounds like an excellent idea! Mindfulness can help you stay present and reduce anxiety. Would you like to try a simple mindfulness exercise together?
Sure, I’d love that.
Let’s do a brief mindful breathing exercise. Find a comfortable position and take a deep breath in through your nose, filling your lungs, and then slowly exhale through your mouth.
Okay, I’m ready.
Great! Let’s do this together for a few breaths. Inhale… and exhale.
(breathes)
Inhale… and exhale.
(breathes)
One more time. Inhale… and exhale.
(breathes)
How do you feel after that exercise?
I feel a bit more relaxed. It’s nice to take a moment to just breathe.
I’m glad to hear that! You can use this technique anytime you feel overwhelmed or need a moment of calm.
I will definitely do that.
Before we wrap up today, is there anything else on your mind that you’d like to discuss?
I think I’m good for now. I’m just grateful for the progress I’ve made.
That’s wonderful to hear! Remember, progress is a journey, and you’re doing great.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! I look forward to hearing about your mindfulness practice next time. Take care!
Bye, Ellie.
Bye!
